intro: Cercocarpus fothergilloides, commonly known as the Fremont cottonwood, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, cottony seeds. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces fruiting bodies called achenes. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for wildlife.
